contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Hanoura'''|羽ノ浦町|Hanoura-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Naka District, Tokushima|Naka District]], [[Tokushima Prefecture|Tokushima]], [[Japan]]. [[File:Hanoura Tokushimna chapter.JPG|thumb|alt=text|Flag of Hanoura, Tokushima]] On March 20, 2006 Hanoura, along with the town of [[Nakagawa, Tokushima|Nakagawa]], also from [[Naka District, Tokushima|Naka District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Anan, Tokushima|Anan]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 12,056 and a [[population density|density]] of 1,415.02 persons per km². The total area was 8.52 km². ==See also== *[[List of towns in Japan]] ==External links== * [http://www.city.anan.tokushima.jp/ Anan official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Tokushima Prefecture]] {{Tokushima-geo-stub}}
